bibl.title: Letter from C.H. Bridges to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 5, 1930

div1.p: Bridges informs Emilie Lawrence Reed that Walter Reed is listed on the Roll of Honor, published in the 1930 Army Register.

div1.head: Letter from C.H. Bridges to Emilie Lawrence Reed, March 5, 1930
div1.opener:
SSL-AWO
WAR DEPARTMENT
THE ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON
March 5, 1930.
IN REPLY
REFER TO
A.G. 005.6 (3-5-30) Pub.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Burlington Hotel,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
I have the honor to advise you that the name of your
husband, Major Walter Reed, appears on the Roll of Honor published
in the Official Army Register for 1930, pursuant to the provisions
of the Act of Congress approved February 28, 1929, (Public No. 858 -
70th Congress). Believing that you will be interested, a copy of the
Register has been mailed to you under separate cover.

closer.signed:
C. H. Bridges
Major General,
The Adjutant General.
By A.J.B.
